Udo Kier Dies At 81, With Kojima Honoring The Red Alert Icon And OD Actor
description: Legendary German actor Udo Kier has died at the age of 81. The news was confirmed by Kier's partner Delbert McBride via Variety. With hundreds of film and TV credits spanning decades, Kier rose to fame in horror films like Mark of the Devil, Flesh for Frankenstein, and Blood for Dracula in the '70s. His breakthrough Hollywood role came in 1991's My Own Private Idaho, and he'd go on to appear in Ace Ventura: Pet Detective, Johnny Mnemonic, Armageddon, and Madonna music videos. In recent years, Kier was one of the actors set to appear in Hideo Kojima's upcoming horror game OD. Game director Hideo Kojima wrote online that new scenes featuring the actor were scheduled to be filmed in 2026, and that he'd kept in touch with him regularly. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Complete Calvin And Hobbes Comic Box Set Is 60% Off At Amazon For Black Friday
description: The Complete Calvin and Hobbes Box Set (Hardcover) $86.15 (was $225) with coupon See at Amazon One of the best comic strips of all time is on sale for an excellent price during Amazon's Black Friday sale. While supplies last--and this deal often sells out during major sales events--The Complete Calvin and Hobbes hardcover box set is available for only $86.15 (was $225). Amazon offered this deal in its early Black Friday sale earlier this month, so if you missed out then, you have another opportunity to add this incredible box set to your bookshelf. To get the full discount, you need to click the coupon box on the store page to save an extra $43.07 at checkout. This beautiful slipcased collection comes with three hardcover books with 1,440 pages of Bill Watterson's iconic comic strip. The Complete Calvin and Hobbes only ever drops this low during big sales like Black Friday and Prime Day. Amazon's deal is so good that the premium hardcover edition is actually cheaper than the paperback version right now. That said, the $91 paperback box set is eligible for Amazon's Buy Two, Get One Free Book Sale this week. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Persona 3 Reload Switch 2 Edition Is Down To $40 For Black Friday
description: Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2) $40 (was $60) See at Amazon If you've picked up a Switch 2 console recently and you're looking to grab a game that'll keep you entertained for nearly 100 hours, Persona 3 Reload comes highly recommended, and it's on sale at Amazon for $40 (was $60) thanks to the retailer's Black Friday event. If you don't own a Switch 2, you can also grab the game on PS5, PS4, and Xbox Series X, but like many of the other video game deals in Amazon's event, these Persona 3 Reload discounts could run out fast, so don't wait--it could be Dark Hour on these deals before you know it. Persona 3 Reload (Switch 2) $40 (was $60) Persona 3 Reload is a full-scale remake of the 2006 classic, introducing new characters, expanded storylines, an all-new voice cast, and a re-recorded soundtrack. The game also features quality-of-life improvements and a redesigned interface that refines the experience while preserving the heart of the cult-classic PS2 original. Note that the Switch 2 version of the game comes on a Game Key-Card, which means none of the game data is included on the cart. Instead, inserting the physical game into your system unlocks the digital version, which you must download to your console before you can start playing. Expect Persona 3 Reload to take up about 25GB on your Switch 2's internal storage or SD card. It's also worth pointing out is that the Episode Aigis DLC expansion is available a separate $35 purchase on the Switch 2 eShop. Episode Aegis adds roughly 30 hours of new story content that takes place after the base game's ending, along with new costumes and music. See at Amazon While Persona 3 Reload came to Switch 2 just a few months ago, it originally launched on PS5, PS4, Xbox Series X, and PC back in early 2024. The physical PlayStation and Xbox versions also happen to be on sale at Amazon, and at much lower prices than the Switch 2 version. You can check out all the Persona 3 Reload Black Friday deals below. All Persona 3 Reload Black Friday Deals Switch 2 -- $40 ($60) PS5 -- $18 ($70) PS4 -- $20 ($70) Xbox Series X -- $25 ($35.16) Persona 3 Reload is just one of several Atlus-published RPGs on sale at Amazon during Black Friday. You can also grab Persona 5 Royal on Switch, Metaphor ReFantazio, Shin Megami Tensei V: Vengeance Edition, and the recently released Raidou Remastered: the Mystery of the Soulless Army. Check out all the Atlus RPG deals at Amazon. And make sure to check out GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub throughout the rest of the month for more price cuts on video games, Blu-rays, board games, and beyond. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Gets Its First Big Discount For Black Friday
description: Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds - Amazon Exclusive Edition $45 (was $70) See at Amazon 2025 has seen a surprising number of fun arcade racing games, including the recent Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, which landed on PS5, Xbox Series X, Nintendo Switch, and PC back in September. And for a limited time during Black Friday, you can get the Amazon Exclusive Edition for just $45 (was $60). That's the lowest price we've seen since launch, and it applies to PS5, Xbox Series X, and Switch versions of the game. This deal will only stick around during Black Friday, however, and because it's the first real discount we've seen for the game, it's a good idea to pick it up now if it's on your wishlist. Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds - Amazon Exclusive Edition $45 (was $70) Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds features 24 tracks, 23 playable characters, and 45 customizable vehicles to try out. The roster features familiar faces from previous Sonic the Hedgehog games, as well as guest racers from other franchises like Mega Man, SpongeBob, Like A Dragon, Persona, Minecraft, and more. The game features full single-player modes, local split-screen support, and online modes for up to 12 players. The Sonic Racing: CrossWorld Amazon Exclusive Edition includes the full base game on your platform of choice, plus an exclusive fold-out poster featuring Sonic, Tails, Shadow, Knuckles, and other familiar faces as they cruise through a variety of worlds. Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds - Amazon Exclusive Edition Black Friday Deal PS5 -- $45 ($70) Xbox -- $45 ($70) Switch -- $45 ($70) See at Amazon Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds Amazon Exclusive EditionThis isn't the only great Sonic deal running during Black Friday. A bunch of games are available for $20 or less on PS5 and Xbox (or $25 on Switch), including Sonic Frontiers (normally $50), Sonic Origins Plus (normally $40), and Sonic Superstars (normally $30). The last two get you fairly traditional 2D platforming action, while Frontiers is a whole new 3D adventure that lets you explore a sprawling open world. Sonic X Shadow Generations is also discounted to $25 (was $50) on Switch, Switch 2, PS5, and Xbox. This recently released collection includes two games in one package: a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations alongside the all-new Shadow Generations. And for more racing fun, you can pick up the Sonic Mania + Team Sonic Racing Double Pack on Switch for just $25 (was $40). Along with the kart racer, Sonic Mania gets you both new zones to explore and old favorites from Sonic 1, 2, 3, and Sonic & Knuckles. Check out all the Black Friday deals on Sonic video games below. For the latest Black Friday deals, be sure to check GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Avatar: The Last Airbender MTG Scene Boxes Finally Back In Stock At Amazon
description: Magic: The Gathering x Avatar: The Last Airbender The full lineup is in stock on launch weekend. See at Amazon Amazon has restocked both Magic: The Gathering Scene Boxes in the new Avatar: The Last Airbender crossover set. The Black Sun Invasion Scene Box is available for $41, and Tea Time at The Jasmine is $47. Outside of brief restock windows, both Scene Boxes had been sold out since shortly after preorders for the Avatar: The Last Airbender set opened in August. The Black Sun Invasion Scene Box is available to ship now, but Tea Time at The Jasmine won't arrive for roughly two weeks, according to Amazon's delivery estimate at the time of writing. Avatar: The Last Airbender joined Magic's Universes Beyond series November 21. As of November 23, Amazon has the full selection of products for Avatar: The Last Airbender fans and MTG collectors to pick from, including Collector Boosters and Collector Booster Boxes. The Commander's Bundle, the most popular product in the launch lineup--and Amazon's No. 1 best-selling TCG product in general--comes with a Collector Booster and everything from the standard Avatar: The Last Airbender Bundle. Magic: The Gathering - Avatar: The Last Airbender Play Booster Box $175.27 (was $209.70) Get deal at Amazon Though not official Black Friday deals--there aren't any MTG Black Friday discounts outside of third-party accessories--three Avatar: The Last Airbender MTG products are discounted right now. Most notably, the Play Booster Box is on sale for $175.27 (was $209.70). The Jumpstart Booster Box is up for grabs for an all-time low price of $120 (was $167.76). You can also save a few bucks on Avatar: The Last Airbender Beginner Box, which comes with 200 cards (10 decks) and everything you need to play Jumpstart with a friend. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Mario Kart Racing Wheel For Switch & Switch 2 Is On Sale For Black Friday
description: Hori Mario Kart Pro Deluxe Racing Wheel for Switch 1/2 $91 (was $110) See at Amazon Hori Mario Kart Pro Mini Racing Wheel for Switch 1/2 $62.68 (was $70) See at Amazon Hori's officially licensed Mario Kart Pro Deluxe Racing Wheel is on sale for $91 (was $110) in Amazon's Black Friday sale. Notably, this wired racing wheel and pedals set is fully compatible with Nintendo Switch and Switch 2. It works great with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe on Switch, Mario Kart World on Switch 2, Sonic Racing: CrossWorlds, and more than two dozen other games on Switch 1/2. It's also compatible with all PC racing games that support XInput. Hori also makes a smaller model for younger players called the Pro Mini. This one doesn't have an official Black Friday discount, but it's on sale for $62.68 (was $70) and comes with pedals, too. Both Hori Racing Wheels have Mario Kart-themed designs with Mario's signature M logo emblazoned on the center of the wheel. Hori Mario Kart Racing Wheel Pro Deluxe for Switch, Switch 2, and PCThe full list of officially supported games can be found on Amazon's store pages for both wheels. Other notable titles include Mario Kart Live: Home Circuit, Lego 2K Drive, Hot Wheels Unleashed 1 and 2, Team Sonic Racing, Crash Team Racing, Chocobo Grand Prix, Paw Patrol Grand Prix, Monster Jam Showdown, and Cars 3. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Meta AI-Powered Ray-Ban Sunglasses Are On Sale For Black Friday
description: Ray-Ban X Meta Smart Glasses - Wayfarer Frames (Gen 1) Starts at $239 See at Amazon If you've ever wished your sunglasses could play music, take photos, or even answer questions for you, then you're in luck. Select Ray-Ban Meta AI Glasses models are seeing generous discounts for Black Friday 2025. These are all Gen 1 models--so they won't have the extended battery life or upgraded cameras of the Gen 2 models--but they still offer many of the same features as the newer models, including Meta AI support, built-in speakers and camera, and more. While the smart glasses are available in a variety of frames and lens styles, it looks like only the Wayfarer frames are currently getting discounts. You can snag a pair for as low as $239.20 (normally $299) thanks to Amazon's sale. Ray-Ban X Meta Smart Glasses - Wayfarer Frames (Gen 1) Starts at $239 If you're unfamiliar with Meta's collaboration with Ray-Ban, these smart glasses aren't your average pair of frames. Inside its larger arms, you'll find heaps of cool tech that lets you ask Meta AI questions, take photos or videos, or listen to music. You can even ask Meta AI what you're looking at, making the smart glasses a helpful travel companion. The frames are only slightly thicker than those of some typical glasses, so unless someone is looking closely, most won't even realize you have a computer sitting on your head. As for the actual specs, you'll find an ultra-wide 12MP camera, a five-mic system for easy voice recognition, an included charging and travel case, and a built-in button to activate its AI. Any images or footage you capture can also be easily shared on Facebook or Instagram. See at Amazon While these AI-powered smart glasses are stylish, they're much simpler compared to AR and VR devices. Those who are interested in something more powerful should also check out Amazon's limited-time Black Friday deals on the Meta Quest 3S VR headset. Amazon has two deals available--the first drops the Mea Quest 3S 128GB model to just $250 (was $300) and includes a $50 Amazon gift card as a free bonus. You can also score the Meta Quest 3S bundle that includes the 256GB model of the headset with a copy of Batman: Arkham Shadow and a $49 Amazon Gift Card for just $329 (was $400). These deals are exclusive to Amazon and won't stick around long, so grab them while you can. Meta Quest 3S VR Headset Black Friday Deals Meta Quest 3S 128GB: Gorilla Tag Bundle + $50 Amazon Credit $250 (was $300) | Amazon Exclusive Get deal at Amazon Meta Quest 3S 256GB: Batman Bundle + $49 Amazon Credit $329 (was $400) Get deal at Amazon The Quest 3S is much bigger than the Ray-Ban AI Smart Glasses, but they're also much more powerful, acting as a complete standalone, wireless VR setup (though you can also plug the headset into your PC or PS5 if you want to play more demanding VR games). If you've been curious about VR gaming but haven't jumped in yet, these bundles are an excellent way to get an affordable VR setup. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Princess Peach's Castle 738-Piece Lego Mario Playset Is Over 50% Off At Amazon
description: Lego Super Mario: Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle (738 Pieces) $28 (was $65) | Retiring soon See at Amazon Update: This deal is no longer available. For the second week in a row, Amazon is selling a Lego Super Mario playset for over 50% off during its Black Friday sale. Last week it was Soda Jungle Maker, and this week it's Battle with Roy at Peach's Castle. Normally $65, this 738-piece building set is discounted to only $28. Like Soda Jungle Maker, Peach's Castle is retiring soon, so this is likely your last chance to get a massive discount on the set. Amazon has already sold out of this deal once today (November 23), but the deal is back in stock as of 5:55 PM PT. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Save $200 On The Lenovo Legion Go S For Black Friday
description: Legion Go S (Z2, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD) $450 (was $650) See at Best Buy Legion Go S (Z1 Extreme, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD) $650 (was $900) See at Best Buy Mobile gaming PCs have taken off over the last couple of years, and if you've been holding out for an early Black Friday deal on one, you're in luck. The Lenovo Legion Go S has been heavily discounted, with prices ranging from $450 (was $650) for the Z2 model with a 512GB SSD and the version with the Z1 Extreme chipset, more RAM, and a 1TB SSD is available for $650 (was $900). These powerful portable gaming devices let you play the latest PC games on the go, making them an excellent gift for the hardcore PC gamer in your life. Just make sure you grab these deals soon, as these Best Buy discounts won't last long. Legion Go S (Z2, 16GB RAM, 512GB SSD) $450 (was $650) The Lenovo Legion Go S comes equipped with an 8-inch 120Hz Lenovo PureSight 1200p display and an AMD Ryzen Z2 Go chip with Radeon graphics. This model includes a 512GB SSD, 16GB of RAM, and it runs on Valve's operating system, SteamOS. Storage can be expanded through the microSD slot if 512GB feels too limiting. Games typically run well from a microSD card on SteamOS, and the Z2 chip paired with Radeon graphics can handle a wide range of titles. The handheld measures 11.75 x 1.71 x 5.02 inches, and it has a 3.5mm audio jack, two USB-C ports, offset thumbsticks, two remappable back triggers, and a small trackpad. See at Best Buy Legion Go S (Z1 Extreme, 32GB RAM, 1TB SSD) $650 (was $900) The higher-end configuration of the Lenovo Legion Go S uses the older but still powerful AMD Ryzen Z1 Extreme chip with AMD RDNA 3 graphics. It has 32GB of RAM and a larger 1TB SSD, and like the model above, it runs on SteamOS. It features the same screen, inputs, and ergonomic design that has earned praise from critics. See at Best Buy Other handheld gaming PCs, such as the recently released ROG Xbox Ally X, are still selling at their regular MSRP, but Best Buy is offering discounts on the MSI Claw. You can save $180 to $265 on two models: the MSI Claw A1M with a 512GB SSD is down to $390, down from $650, while the 1TB version is $565 (was $750). These units feature 7-inch 1080p screens with a 120Hz refresh rate; 16GB of RAM, Intel Arc Graphics 8X cores, and Intel Core Ultra processors. MSI Claw A1MBoth MSI Claw models run Windows 11, which means you can load games from multiple storefronts, including Steam, GOG, and the Epic Games Store. The trade-off is that Windows can be cumbersome on a handheld PC, but if that does not bother you, you will have far more flexibility when installing and managing games. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Sonic X Shadow Generations for Switch 2 is 50% off (BF2025)
description: Sonic X Shadow Generations $25 (was $50) See all at Amazon Sonic X Shadow Generations launched just over a year ago on Switch, PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC, and recently got an official port to Switch 2 just a few months ago. The game features a remaster of 2011's Sonic Generations alongside the all-new Shadow Generations, offering fans two completely unique games in one package. And now, for Black Friday 2025, the game is discounted to its lowest price ever of just $25 (was $50) on Nintendo Switch 2, Nintendo Switch, PS5, and Xbox Series X. You'll also find a bunch of other Sonic games on sale during the event, making this a good time to stock up on titles you may have missed over the past few years. Sonic X Shadow Generations $25 (was $50) Sonic X Shadow Generations offers both 3D and 2D adventures, playing as a greatest-hits roundup for the Blue Blur. For a change of pace, however, you can dive into Shadow Generations, which lets you take control of Shadow as he fights through a brand new adventure. There are plenty of Easter eggs and additional content packed into the bundle--so even once you beat the game, there's always a reason to come back for more. This includes hidden Chao across each level, a chance to play pinball in the Casino Nights zone, and a museum featuring all sorts of behind-the-scenes material. Sonic X Shadow Generations Deals At Amazon PS5 -- $25 ($50) Xbox -- $25 ($50) Switch -- $25 ($50) Switch 2 -- $25 ($50) See all at Amazon Our Sonic X Shadow Generations review called it a "nice enough trip down memory lane," though it does come with some friction due to the age of Sonic Generations. If you're a Sonic fan, you'll probably find something here of value (especially at $25). "Shadow Generations' story is a great opportunity to revisit some of Shadow's most memorable moments as well as past boss battles against other artificial beings that could be considered rivals to the title of "ultimate life form," like the Biolizard from Sonic Adventure 2," wrote critic Jordan Ram√©e. "I was grinning like a kid again when Shadow faced off against Metal Overlord and Crush 40's "What I'm Made Of..." started playing, reminding me of the hours I lost to Sonic Heroes when I was 10 years old." Many other Sonic games are on sale for Black Friday, including Sonic Frontiers, which is down to $18 on PS5, $16 on PS4, $10 on Xbox Series X, and $25 on Switch. You can also pick up the Sonic Mania + Team Sonic Racing Double Pack for just $20 (was $40). You'll find a list of even more Sonic game deals below. While these are big discounts on some of the Blue Hedgehog's latest games, keep in mind these deals will likely vanish after Black Friday, so be sure to take advantage of them while they're still active. For more on the latest Black Friday video game discounts, be sure to check GameSpot's Black Friday Deals Hub. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Bessent believes there won't be a recession in 2026 but says some sectors are challenged
description: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said the U.S. was not at risk of entering a recession in 2026 and that Americans would soon benefit from Trump's policies.

description: The Berlin Apartment documents the lives of four individuals at four turbulent periods in Germany's history.

description: The experimental Beatles and Zelda YouTube mashups more than make up for the lost John Lennon Lord of the Rings musical movie.

title: Navy intercepts two Russian ships in English Channel

description: Sarah Forrester, 55, has been named as the woman who died in a house in Swindon on Friday.

title: Toy Story is 30, so we're looking back at how it was nearly canceled

title: More companies are shifting workers to passwordless authentication

title: 56-year-old man got over $170,000 in student loan forgiveness under Trump: 'I could not believe it'
description: Daniel Gray worried about his student debt for more than two decades. The day after he turned 56, he learned that his over $170,000 balance would be forgiven.

title: Trump claims California's $20 fast-food minimum wage hurts businesses. The truth is a lot more complicated
description: The restaurant industry predicted disaster after California instituted a $20 minimum wage for fast-food workers, but data shows that hasn't happened.
